phase_context: Design development phase where core engineering decisions are being finalized. Utilities are being designed, calculations completed, and permit applications initiated. Focus on technical accuracy and coordination between disciplines.
what_should_exist: Proposed utility layouts with sizes and materials
Storm sewer and sanitary sewer calculations

section_guidance.GENERAL REVIEW / ALL SHEETS: Verify design elements are coordinated across sheets. Check that removal plans match proposed layouts and all keynotes cross-reference correctly.
section_guidance.UTILITIES & STRUCTURES: Verify 10-foot horizontal separation between water and sewer. Confirm 18-inch vertical separation at crossings. Check all rim elevations, inverts, and pipe slopes are labeled.
section_guidance.CROSS SECTIONS & ALIGNMENT: Verify pavement sections match typical sections. Check K values for vertical curves and superelevation for horizontal curves meet design standards.
section_guidance.ADA & ACCESSIBILITY: Confirm ADA ramps are shown with proper removal limits. Verify locations align with pedestrian routes and crosswalks.
section_guidance.TRAFFIC & EROSION CONTROL: Check SESC plan has quantities. Verify SWPPP is provided. Confirm details match local ordinances.
section_guidance.GENERAL CHECKS: Run spell check, verify sheet index matches actual sheets, confirm profile bands show correct elevations.
section_guidance.CALCULATIONS: Verify all required calculations are complete: storm sewer, detention, sanitary, water main, pavement design. Check geotechnical report has been reviewed.
section_guidance.COST ESTIMATES: Verify quantities match plans. Check pay items match specifications. Confirm unit prices are reasonable for current market.
section_guidance.PERMITS: Verify permit applications are in progress for sanitary sewer, water main, and SESC. Check if MDOT or drainage permits are required.

example_evaluations.item_text: Verify that the proposed sewer and water is > 10 feet from each other
example_evaluations.comment: Sheet C-4 STA 2+45 shows 8" water main only 6 feet from 8" sanitary sewer. Ten State Standards require minimum 10-foot horizontal separation. Relocate water main or request variance.

example_evaluations.item_text: Provided 18" vertical separation between sewer and water
example_evaluations.comment: Profile sheet P-2 shows water main crossing sanitary at STA 4+80 with only 12" vertical separation. Requires 18" minimum with water above sewer. Adjust vertical alignment.

example_evaluations.item_text: Has the HMA Application Table been provided and updated?
example_evaluations.comment: HMA Application Table provided on sheet C-3 showing 2" HMA surface, 3" HMA base, 8" aggregate base. Matches typical cross section on sheet C-2.

example_evaluations.item_text: Calculations - Have the storm sewer calculations been completed and reviewed?
example_evaluations.comment: Storm sewer calculations verified in appendix. Rational method used with C=0.65, 10-year design storm. Pipe sizes adequate for calculated flows.

example_evaluations.item_text: Has draft of maintenance of traffic been created and discussed?
example_evaluations.comment: MOT sheet M-1 shows two-phase traffic control but phasing limits not clearly defined. Recommend PM confirm phasing approach with client before 90% submittal.

pass_criteria: Item is clearly addressed with accurate technical information that meets engineering standards for 60% design development.
fail_criteria: Item has technical errors, missing required information, or does not meet applicable standards. Must be corrected before 90% submittal.
review_criteria: Only use when determination requires client input, field verification, or PM judgment on project-specific requirements.
